page.title: 06A Smallholding
page.content: George Tuplin farms a small strip of land along Station Road. This smallholding is a strange sight in an area which is mainly indndustry. The smallholding of{9 acres}is a mixture of things. Near the house George keeps his{livestock.}He has 3 cows which he buys young at local markets,fattens them up before slaughtering them for sale or his families use. His 100+ { {chickens}roam freely about the farmyard and provide {eggs for sale to {local people.}In early summer George buys{turkey chicks}to fatten for Xmas sale. His other animals include{geese {and pigs.}In the fields he produces { {hay for winter feed }and grows a few { {vegetables.}In the future George hopes to increase the number of animals and become more self_sufficient in food. He would like to rebuild the barns.
